intro: Warneckea sansibarica subsp. buchananii, commonly known as the East African warneckea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the coastal regions of East Africa, including Tanzania and Kenya. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. This species is often found in coastal woodlands and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
